DOC.brief_summary: This study will look at general pediatricians' effectiveness at screening children for elevated blood pressure values in the primary care setting. Two new screening tools will be introduced and their effectiveness will be measured against current practice by way of medical chart review.
DOC.brief_title: Recognition of Abnormal Pediatric Blood Pressures in Primary Care
DOC.criteria: Health care supervision visit Documented measured blood pressure and height Between the ages of 3 years and 17 years Younger than 3 years of age Older than 17 years of age No documented blood pressure measurement Not a health supervision encounter
